ai_data_engineering.title: AI Horror Stories: From Scheming Models to Zombie Automations
ai_data_engineering.summary: As GenAI apps and agents grow in power and autonomy, a darker side of AI emerges. They are beginning to mimic obedience, feign control, and outlive their utility. Beneath the surface of slick demos and clean dashboards, scheming models, zombie automations, and hallucinating data loops are spreading through enterprise ecosystems like digital hauntings.

ai_data_engineering.title: Why Analyst Attention Is the Scarce Resource of 2025
ai_data_engineering.summary: You open your analytics workspace and see forty new AI-generated alerts before your first meeting. A few of these signals could change next quarter’s numbers. Most are noise. Data is everywhere, and AI runs without rest. Dashboards refresh faster, models retrain overnight, and agents surface insights in real time. Yet decisions still stall. The real restriction in analytics today isn’t access or speed. It’s attention, specifically human attention, the kind that knows how to separate what matters from what merely looks interesting.

cloud.title: GitHub Universe 2025: Where developer innovation took center stage
cloud.summary: At GitHub Universe 2025, the theme was clear: the ability to see, steer, and build across agents will bring the greatest impact. The post GitHub Universe 2025: Where developer innovation took center stage appeared first on Microsoft Azure Blog .

cloud.title: Introducing Agent HQ: Any agent, any way you work
cloud.summary: At Universe 2025, GitHub’s next evolution introduces a single, unified workflow for developers to be able to orchestrate any agent, any time, anywhere. The post Introducing Agent HQ: Any agent, any way you work appeared first on Microsoft Azure Blog .

cloud.title: AWS Weekly Roundup: AWS RTB Fabric, AWS Customer Carbon Footprint Tool, AWS Secret-West Region, and more (October 27, 2025)
cloud.summary: This week started with challenges for many using services in the the North Virginia (us-east-1) Region. On Monday, we experienced a service disruption affecting DynamoDB and several other services due to a DNS configuration problem. The issue has been fully resolved, and you can read the full details in our official summary. As someone who […]

cloud_infra_observability.title: Amazon Kinesis Data Streams now supports 10x larger record sizes: Simplifying real-time data processing
cloud_infra_observability.summary: Today, AWS announced that Amazon Kinesis Data Streams now supports record sizes up to 10MiB – a tenfold increase from the previous limit. In this post, we explore Amazon Kinesis Data Streams large record support, including key use cases, configuration of maximum record sizes, throttling considerations, and best practices for optimal performance.

cloud_infra_observability.title: Federate access to SageMaker Unified Studio with AWS IAM Identity Center and Okta
cloud_infra_observability.summary: This post shows step-by-step guidance to setup workforce access to Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio using Okta as an external Identity provider with AWS IAM Identity Center.

dataprep_orchestration_etl.title: Dagster Supports Every Dev Lifecycle Step
dataprep_orchestration_etl.summary: Dagster supports every stage of the data lifecycle, from local dev to prod deployment, with versioning, testing, and observability built in.

dataprep_orchestration_etl.title: Track Branch Deployments in Dagster+
dataprep_orchestration_etl.summary: Dagster+ enhances pipeline change tracking and collaboration through better branch deployment visibility.

dataprep_orchestration_etl.title: Dagster 1.4: dbt & Asset Controls
dataprep_orchestration_etl.summary: Dagster 1.4 adds enhanced dbt support and asset materialization controls to give you more orchestration power.

dataprep_orchestration_etl.title: Introducing Airbyte Plus: Predictable Pricing for Growing Teams | Airbyte
dataprep_orchestration_etl.summary: Airbyte Plus offers transparent, predictable pricing built for growing teams. Simplify budgeting, scale your data operations confidently, and access premium features without surprise costs.

db_sql_olap.title: Build a Better Data Lake with MotherDuck
db_sql_olap.summary: Learn how MotherDuck and DuckDB simplify collaboration and power one-system data lakes with minimal setup and high performance.

db_sql_olap.title: Snowflake Destination Enhancements: 10x Faster, 95% Cheaper | Airbyte
db_sql_olap.summary: Discover how Airbyte’s enhanced Snowflake destination delivers up to 10x faster sync speeds and 95% cost reduction.

ml_ai.title: AI Horror Stories: From Scheming Models to Zombie Automations
ml_ai.summary: As GenAI apps and agents grow in power and autonomy, a darker side of AI emerges. They are beginning to mimic obedience, feign control, and outlive their utility. Beneath the surface of slick demos and clean dashboards, scheming models, zombie automations, and hallucinating data loops are spreading through enterprise ecosystems like digital hauntings.

ml_ai.title: Anonymous credentials: rate-limiting bots and agents without compromising privacy
ml_ai.summary: As AI agents change how the Internet is used, they create a challenge for security. We explore how Anonymous Credentials can rate limit agent traffic and block abuse without tracking users or compromising their privacy.

ml_ai.title: Introducing LangSmith’s No Code Agent Builder
ml_ai.summary: By Brace Sproul and Sam Crowder Today, we’re expanding who can build agents beyond developers. While a lot of the highest volume, customer-facing agents will be built by technical teams, nearly every business user has use cases for agentic applications in their daily routines. Our new LangSmith Agent

ml_ai.title: Preparing for the General Availability of the new Card visual
ml_ai.summary: One change may impact the behavior and look of the new card visual in existing reports. The callout size and background setting will be available with or without a divider after GA.

ml_ai.title: Build more accurate AI applications with Amazon Nova Web Grounding
ml_ai.summary: AWS announced Amazon Nova Web Grounding, a new built-in tool for Nova models on Amazon Bedrock that automatically retrieves current, cited information to reduce AI hallucinations and improve accuracy in applications requiring up-to-date factual data.

ml_ai.title: Building the future together: Microsoft and NVIDIA announce AI advancements at GTC DC
ml_ai.summary: New offerings in Azure AI Foundry give businesses an enterprise-grade platform to build, deploy, and scale AI applications and agents. The post Building the future together: Microsoft and NVIDIA announce AI advancements at GTC DC appeared first on Microsoft Azure Blog .

ml_ai.title: Doubling down on DeepAgents
ml_ai.summary: Two months ago we wrote about Deep Agents - a term we coined for agents that are able to do complex, open ended tasks over longer time horizons. We hypothesized that there were four key elements to those agents: a planning tool, access to a filesystem, subagents, and detailed prompts.

ml_ai.title: Amazon Nova Multimodal Embeddings: State-of-the-art embedding model for agentic RAG and semantic search
ml_ai.summary: Amazon Nova Multimodal Embeddings is a new state-of-the-art embedding model available in Amazon Bedrock. It is the industry’s first embedding model that supports text, documents, images, video, and audio through a single unified model, enabling cross-modal retrieval and semantic search applications with leading accuracy, at industry-leading costs.

ml_ai.title: Why Analyst Attention Is the Scarce Resource of 2025
ml_ai.summary: You open your analytics workspace and see forty new AI-generated alerts before your first meeting. A few of these signals could change next quarter’s numbers. Most are noise. Data is everywhere, and AI runs without rest. Dashboards refresh faster, models retrain overnight, and agents surface insights in real time. Yet decisions still stall. The real restriction in analytics today isn’t access or speed. It’s attention, specifically human attention, the kind that knows how to separate what matters from what merely looks interesting.

news.title: We’re All Living in Different Data Decades
news.summary: 200 Newsletters Later, What I’ve Learned About Data, Careers, and Change

news_general.title: Resiliency in the cloud—empowered by shared responsibility and Azure Essentials
news_general.summary: Empowering organizations to shape the future of cloud with resilient, always-on solutions. The post Resiliency in the cloud—empowered by shared responsibility and Azure Essentials appeared first on Microsoft Azure Blog .

news_general.title: BGP zombies and excessive path hunting
news_general.summary: A BGP “zombie” is essentially a route that has become stuck in the Default-Free Zone (DFZ) of the Internet, potentially due to a missed or lost prefix withdrawal. We’ll walk through some situations where BGP zombies are more likely to rise from the dead and wreak havoc.

news_general.title: Le Comptoir OCTO - Repenser la souveraineté numérique
news_general.summary: La souveraineté numérique n’est pas une affaire de drapeaux ou de serveurs nationaux. C’est une question de posture, de maîtrise et de responsabilité collective. Retour sur un comptoir OCTO, dédié à la souveraineté numérique et à la gestion du risque industriel dans le cloud.

news_general.title: Dagster 1.12: Refinement and Acceleration
news_general.summary: Dagster 1.12 makes data orchestration faster, simpler, and more reliable with a redesigned UI, Components GA, streamlined deployment workflows, and major orchestration upgrades.

news_general.title: High-Performance Python for Pipelines
news_general.summary: Use proven tips to make your Python code faster and more efficient, especially for data engineering and pipeline-heavy workloads.

news_general.title: Policy, privacy and post-quantum: anonymous credentials for everyone
news_general.summary: The world is adopting anonymous credentials for digital privacy, but these systems are vulnerable to quantum computers. This post explores the cryptographic challenges and promising research paths toward building new, quantum-resistant credentials from the ground up.

news_general.title: Measuring characteristics of TCP connections at Internet scale
news_general.summary: Researchers and practitioners have been studying connections almost as long as the Internet that supports them. Today, Cloudflare’s global network receives millions of connections per second. We explore various characteristics of TCP connections, including lifetimes, sizes, and more.

news_general.title: How to build your own VPN, or: the history of WARP
news_general.summary: WARP’s initial implementation resembled a VPN that allows Internet access through it. Here’s how we built it – and how you can, too.

news_general.title: Defending QUIC from acknowledgement-based DDoS attacks
news_general.summary: We identified and patched two DDoS vulnerabilities in our QUIC implementation related to packet acknowledgements. Cloudflare customers were not affected. We examine the "Optimistic ACK" attack vector and our solution, which dynamically skips packet numbers to validate client behavior.

news_general.title: So long, and thanks for all the fish: how to escape the Linux networking stack
news_general.summary: Many products at Cloudflare aren’t possible without pushing the limits of network hardware and software to deliver improved performance, increased efficiency, or novel capabilities such as soft-unicast, our method for sharing IP subnets across data centers. Happily, most people do not need to know the intricacies of how your operating system handles network and Internet access in general. Yes, even most people within Cloudflare. But sometimes we try to push well beyond the design intentions of Linux’s networking stack. This is a story about one of those attempts.

news_general.title: Helping protect the 2025 Moldova elections
news_general.summary: Cloudflare mitigated a 12-hour DDoS attack against Moldova's Central Election Commission, blocking over 898 million malicious requests that peaked at 324,333 requests per second. This defense kept critical election infrastructure online and accessible for citizens during a critical parliamentary vote.

news_general.title: Building a Healthcare Robot from Simulation to Deployment with NVIDIA Isaac
news_general.summary:
Building a Healthcare Robot from Simulation to Deployment with NVIDIA Isaac
A hands-on guide to collecting data, training policies, and deploying autonomous medical robotics workflows on real hardware
Table-of-Contents
Introduction
Simulation has been a cornerstone in medical imaging to address the

news_general.title: State of the post-quantum Internet in 2025
news_general.summary: Today over half of human-initiated traffic with Cloudflare is protected against harvest-now/decrypt-later with post-quantum encryption. What once was a cool science project, is the new security baseline for the Internet. We’re not done yet: in this blog post we’ll take measure where we are, what we expect for the coming years, and what you can do today.

news_general.title: Keeping the Internet fast and secure: introducing Merkle Tree Certificates
news_general.summary: Cloudflare is launching an experiment with Chrome to evaluate fast, scalable, and quantum-ready Merkle Tree Certificates, all without degrading performance or changing WebPKI trust relationships.

news_general.title: A framework for measuring Internet resilience
news_general.summary: We present a data-driven framework to quantify cross-layer Internet resilience. We also share a list of measurements with which to quantify facets of Internet resilience for geographical areas.

news_general.title: Streaming datasets: 100x More Efficient
news_general.summary:
Streaming datasets: 100x More Efficient
We boosted
load_dataset('dataset', streaming=True)
, streaming datasets without downloading them with one line of code!
Start training on multi-TB datasets immediately, without complex setups, downloading, no "disk out of space", or 429 “stop requesting!” erro

python_polars_duckdb.summary:

has reached v1.0 - a milestone that marks the library's maturity as the Python package powering
200,000 dependent libraries
and providing core functionality fo

viz_bi.title: Power BI app Copilot: AI scoped to the curated content in an app (Preview)
viz_bi.summary: Announcing Power BI app Copilot, now in preview. With app-scoped Copilot, users can search for reports in an app plus ask questions and get connected with answers based on a report in an app. App Copilot is a separate complement to report-scoped Copilot already available on each report viewed in an app.

viz_bi.title: Deprecation Announcement: Office Online Server Retirement and What it Means for Power BI Report Server Users
viz_bi.summary: What’s Changing? Microsoft has announced that Office Online Server (OOS) will be retired effective December 31, 2026. As a result, PBIRS users will no longer be able to host Excel workbooks in PBIRS using OOS after November 2026, in accordance with the PBIRS Support Timelines Policy. Additionally, beginning with the January 2026 PBIRS release, configuration … Continue reading “Deprecation Announcement: Office Online Server Retirement and What it Means for Power BI Report Server Users”

viz_bi.title: Introducing Power BI Controller: Streamlining Storytelling with Bulk Operations (Preview)
viz_bi.summary: This feature was developed in direct response to feedback from our user community and is designed to provide an efficient tool for managing multiple Power BI add-ins within PowerPoint presentations. Background Power BI Storytelling enables users to embed interactive reports and visuals into PowerPoint, supporting data-driven presentations across organizations. As adoption has grown, many of … Continue reading “Introducing Power BI Controller: Streamlining Storytelling with Bulk Operations (Preview)”

warehouses_engines.title: Use trusted identity propagation for Apache Spark interactive sessions in Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio
warehouses_engines.summary: In this post, we provide step-by-step instructions to set up Amazon EMR on EC2, EMR Serverless, and AWS Glue within SageMaker Unified Studio, enabled with trusted identity propagation. We use the setup to illustrate how different IAM Identity Center users can run their Spark sessions, using each compute setup, within the same project in SageMaker Unified Studio. We show how each user will see only tables or part of tables that they’re granted access to in Lake Formation.
